name: Lorenzo Orio

projects.title: Wiser Plus üìö
projects.description: An open-source browser extension for a quick professor and course rating look up, directly in the school system when signing up for new classes using Typescript, Plasmo and RateMyProff API. With over 60 active users on the Chrome Store.

projects.title: Water Hub üíß
projects.description: A project developed on the ESP32 platform that makes the fridge and life smarter. Built to automatically fill up anything me and my roommates use to drink and track the intake of the fluids. Thanks to a Firebase database and a Web-App, it provides outside-the-house tracking, feedback, and visualization of intake to always stay on track with water consumption.

projects.title: Parrot ü¶úüè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è
projects.description: An open-source browser extension developed on Plasmo for media enthusiasts that easily provides trailers, multiple reviews, posters, and much more withing the websites. Specifically designed to work on multiple torrents websites. The extension also comes with other features such as bad file detection, UHD detection, and more, these features can be easily set by the user to make the experience more personalized. I do not host any copyrighted material I only use publicly available data.

projects.title: Enterprise-Grade Homelab üíæ
projects.description: A geo-redundant homelab using Proxmox and Kubernetes with high-availability clustering, backed by ZFS on TrueNAS and VLAN segmentation via pfSense. Deployed GitLab CI/CD, SonarQube, and Vault for secure DevOps pipelines. Automated Active Directory, backups, and infrastructure provisioning using Ansible and Terraform. Monitored via Prometheus and Grafana, serving 25 active users. Runs on dual Xeon nodes with ECC memory, SSD caching, and 10GbE networking for high-speed, fault-tolerant performance.

projects.title: Bio-Visual
projects.description: The Bio-Visual project is an advanced 3D virtual laboratory that provides an interactive and immersive environment for biological experimentation and learning. This project leverages cutting-edge web technologies to simulate real-world lab scenarios, making it ideal for educational purposes, training, or research demonstrations.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio
projects.description: A modern personal portfolio built with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript, integrated with Google APIs. This site showcases my projects, skills, and interests across software engineering, cybersecurity, and photography ‚Äî all in a fast, responsive, and minimalist design.

experiences.position: Software Lab Intern @ Academy of Digital Odontostomatology (AIOD)
experiences.bullets: Created and helped project-manage over 100 dental surgery cases utilizing software like Exocad and 3Shape. , Collaborated with a team of doctors and patients to ensure 100% of issues were identified early and solutions found in a proactive manner.

experiences.position: Software Engineering Tutor @ University Of Massachusetts Boston
experiences.bullets: Supervised 30 students per week by actively tracking improvements design and development of both software and the students to deliver functional software projects. , Held weekly group session boosting teamwork and collaborative learning by at least 50%.

experiences.position: Course Assistant for Data Structures and Algorithms @ University Of Massachusetts Boston
experiences.bullets: Assisting 60 students 4 times a week in learning data structure - syntax and algorithms in Python and Java. ,  Assisting in visualizing and approaching complex problems. Held interactive office hours increasing attendance by 20% and boosting students grades.

Led YubiKey MFA integration for Tyler ERP via ADFS replacing Entre ID; supported deployment planning secure provisioning and user training for 500+ municipal employees under a 3-month timeline., Tested and implemented YubiKey authentication across Fortinet VPN; Exchange 2019; and Windows logins; configured FortiAuthenticator and assisted in cross-platform secure login workflows and documentation.

Reverse-engineered IncuCyte imaging systems to design next-generation bioreactors capable of real-time cell growth monitoring and optimization integrating biology engineering and software innovation creating systems that make cell analytics more accessible and scalable.

activities.bullets: Organized and ran UMASS Boston Hackathon as technical lead planner reaching over 120 participants.
Volunteered to clean up Boston beaches and help grocery store packaging and support community.

activities.title: THE FUTURE IS NOW! by Bruno Siciliano
activities.description:
I had the privilege of organizing an inspiring seminar titled "The Future is Now! Robotics Meets AI & 5G" at UMass Boston, featuring the esteemed professor Bruno Siciliano from the University of Naples Federico II. ü§ñüß†üì°

This event brought together students, faculty, and robotics enthusiasts to explore cutting-edge advancements at the intersection of robotics, artificial intelligence, and 5G technology. Professor Siciliano's insights into the future potential of these technologies were both thought-provoking and motivating. We discussed how these advancements are reshaping industries and creating new opportunities.

A heartfelt thank you to Oracle, the Deans of Students, the Computer Science & Engineering Department, and our Student Robotics Club for their invaluable support in making this event a success. And, of course, our deepest appreciation to Bruno Siciliano for joining us and sharing his expertise. Events like these remind us of the incredible impact that collaboration and innovation can have on the future.

Looking forward to more inspiring collaborations like this!
activities.about: An event organized in collaboration with the UMass Boston Computer Science Department and Student Robotics Club to bring world-class expertise in robotics and AI to our campus.
activities.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

activities.title: MEDITECH
activities.description:
‚ú® I'm excited to announce that I will be joining MEDITECH as their newest Software Developer! ‚ú®

I can't wait to see where this new chapter of my career will take me, and I look forward to contributing to MEDITECH's mission of advancing healthcare through innovative technology. üöÄ
activities.about: Starting my professional career as a Software Developer at MEDITECH, a leading healthcare IT company.
activities.quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
